focus_skills: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
One-variable data: distributions and measures of center and spread

questions.question: If <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>13</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add 13 to both sides: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn></math>. Divide by 5: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable by performing inverse operations on both sides of the equation.

questions.question: The line with equation <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math> passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute the coordinates into the equation: <math><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. This simplifies to <math><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. Solving gives <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: A point lies on a line if its coordinates satisfy the line's equation. Substitute and solve for the unknown.

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to <math><mn>6</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute: <math><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Combine like terms: <math><mn>9</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>42</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the distributive property carefully, paying attention to signs. Then combine like terms systematically.

questions.skill: One-variable data: distributions and measures of center and spread
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='250' viewBox='0 0 400 250' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='250' fill='white'/><text x='200' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Average Weekly Study Hours</text><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='350' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='45' y='220' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>0</text><text x='45' y='170' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>5</text><text x='45' y='120' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>10</text><text x='45' y='70' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>15</text><text x='45' y='55' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Hours</text><rect x='70' y='140' width='40' height='60' fill='lightblue' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='90' y='210' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Freshmen</text><rect x='150' y='100' width='40' height='100' fill='lightblue' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='170' y='210' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Sophomores</text><rect x='230' y='120' width='40' height='80' fill='lightblue' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='250' y='210' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Juniors</text><rect x='310' y='80' width='40' height='120' fill='lightblue' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='330' y='210' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Seniors</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A bar chart titled 'Average Weekly Study Hours' with four bars labeled Freshmen, Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors. The y-axis is labeled 'Hours' and goes from 0 to 15. The approximate heights of the bars are: Freshmen ~8 hrs, Sophomores ~10 hrs, Juniors ~9 hrs, Seniors ~12 hrs.
questions.question: The bar chart shows the average weekly study hours for students in four grade levels. Which grade level has the highest average?
questions.explanation: The bar representing 'Seniors' extends to approximately 12 hours on the y-axis, which is higher than the bars for the other grade levels.
questions.score_improvement_tip: On bar charts, the category with the highest value corresponds to the tallest bar. Read the value by comparing the top of the bar to the scale on the y-axis.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question: If <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Solve the system. From the second equation: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></math>. Substitute into the first: <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> → <math><mn>5</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. So <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving a system of equations, look for the most efficient method (substitution, elimination) based on how the equations are arranged. Sometimes solving for the combination of variables (like x+y) directly is faster than finding each variable individually.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>, where <math><mi>c</mi></math> is a constant. If the graph of <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> in the xy-plane intersects the x-axis at exactly one point, what is the value of <math><mi>c</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: A parabola intersects the x-axis at exactly one point when its vertex lies on the x-axis, meaning the quadratic equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> has a double root (discriminant = 0). The discriminant is <math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>−6</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi></math>. Set equal to 0: <math><mn>36</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math> → <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The number of x-intercepts of a quadratic function is determined by its discriminant (b² - 4ac). One intercept means discriminant = 0.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='350' height='250' viewBox='0 0 350 250' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='350' height='250' fill='white'/><text x='175' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Note: Figure not drawn to scale.</text><polygon points='100,150 250,150 100,80' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='95' y='145' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>A</text><text x='255' y='155' text-anchor='start' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>B</text><text x='95' y='75' text-anchor='end' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>C</text><text x='170' y='165' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>15</text><text x='120' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>17</text><text x='220' y='120' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'><mi>x</mi></text><path d='M100,145 L110,145 L110,135' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle ABC, where angle C is the right angle. Side AC (vertical leg) is labeled 15. Side BC (horizontal leg) is labeled x. The hypotenuse AB is labeled 17.
questions.question: In right triangle <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, angle <math><mi>C</mi></math> is the right angle. The length of side <math><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math> is <math><mn>15</mn></math> and the length of side <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> is <math><mn>17</mn></math>. What is the length of side <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, denoted by <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: By the Pythagorean Theorem: <math><msup><mi>AC</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>BC</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>AB</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Substituting: <math><msup><mn>15</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>17</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. This gives <math><mn>225</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>289</mn></math>. So <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>64</mn></math>, and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math> (since length is positive).
questions.score_improvement_tip: In a right triangle, always identify the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle). The Pythagorean Theorem applies: leg² + leg² = hypotenuse².

questions.question: A store increased the price of an item by 25%. After a few weeks, the store decreased the new price by <math><mi>k</mi></math>% so that the final price was 10% greater than the original price. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Let the original price be <math><mi>P</mi></math>. After a 25% increase, the price becomes <math><mn>1.25</mn><mi>P</mi></math>. A decrease of <math><mi>k</mi></math>% means multiplying by <math><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></math>. The final price is <math><mn>1.25</mn><mi>P</mi><mo>×</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></math>. This is equal to <math><mn>1.10</mn><mi>P</mi></math> (10% greater than original). Cancel <math><mi>P</mi></math>: <math><mn>1.25</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1.10</mn></math>. Solve: <math><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1.10</mn><mn>1.25</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.88</mn></math>. So <math><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn></math>, and <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For successive percent changes, use multiplication factors (e.g., a p% increase multiplies by (1 + p/100)). Set up an equation and solve for the unknown percentage.

questions.question: What is the positive solution to the equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor the quadratic: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The solutions are <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. The positive solution is <math><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To solve a quadratic equation, first try factoring. Look for two numbers that multiply to the constant term (-36) and add to the linear coefficient (5).

questions.question: Which of the following numbers is a solution to the inequality <math><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Solve the inequality: <math><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Subtract 3 from both sides: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. Subtract 7x: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. Divide by -9 (remember to reverse the inequality sign): <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac></math>. So the solution set is all numbers greater than or equal to approximately -0.777. Check the options: -2 and -1 are less than -0.777, so they are NOT solutions. 0 and 1 are both ≥ -0.777. Among these, 0 is listed as option C.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving inequalities, remember to reverse the inequality sign if you multiply or divide by a negative number. Always check your solution by testing a value from the solution set.

questions.skill: One-variable data: distributions and measures of center and spread
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><text x='200' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Boxplot Summary of Two Data Sets</text><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='40' y='270' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>10</text><text x='140' y='270' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>20</text><text x='240' y='270' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>30</text><text x='340' y='270' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>40</text><text x='200' y='290' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Value</text><rect x='80' y='180' width='120' height='40' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='140' y1='180' x2='140' y2='220' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='80' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='200' x2='220' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='140' y='170' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Group X</text><rect x='180' y='120' width='120' height='40' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='240' y1='120' x2='240' y2='160' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='140' x2='180' y2='140' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='140' x2='330' y2='140' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='240' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Group Y</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two horizontal box plots on a common scale from 10 to 40. For Group X: left whisker at ~15, box from ~20 to ~30, median line inside box at ~25, right whisker at ~35. For Group Y: left whisker at ~10, box from ~15 to ~25, median line inside box at ~20, right whisker at ~30.
questions.question: The box plots summarize the distributions of values for two groups, X and Y. Based on the box plots, which of the following statements must be true?

options.A: The range of Group X is greater than the range of Group Y.
options.B: The interquartile range (IQR) of Group X is greater than the IQR of Group Y.
options.C: The median of Group X is greater than the median of Group Y.
options.D: The mean of Group X is greater than the mean of Group Y.

questions.explanation: From the box plots: Group X median is at approximately 25, Group Y median is at approximately 20. Therefore, the median of Group X is greater than the median of Group Y. (A) Range: Group X range ~35-15=20, Group Y range ~30-10=20. They are equal, not greater. (B) IQR: Group X IQR ~30-20=10, Group Y IQR ~25-15=10. They are equal. (D) The mean cannot be determined from a box plot alone, as it is influenced by the specific distribution of values within each quartile.
questions.score_improvement_tip: A box plot shows the minimum, first quartile (Q1), median (Q2), third quartile (Q3), and maximum. The median is the line inside the box. The IQR is Q3 - Q1. The range is max - min. The mean cannot be reliably determined from a box plot.

questions.question:
In the system of equations below, a and b are constants.
2x+ay=16
bx−4y=20
If the system has no solution, what is the value of ab?
questions.explanation: A system of linear equations has no solution when the lines are parallel (same slope, different y-intercepts). Write both equations in slope-intercept form (<math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>). First equation: <math><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>16</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac></math>. Slope <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac></math>. Second equation: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>20</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Slope <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. For parallel lines: <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. So <math><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. Cross-multiply: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></math>. To find <math><mi>a</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, solve for the ratio: <math><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: A system has no solution when the lines are parallel (equal slopes) but have different y-intercepts. Convert equations to slope-intercept form to compare slopes and intercepts.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='350' height='250' viewBox='0 0 350 250' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='350' height='250' fill='white'/><text x='175' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Note: Figure not drawn to scale.</text><rect x='100' y='100' width='120' height='80' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='140' y2='60' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><line x1='220' y1='100' x2='260' y2='60' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><line x1='140' y1='60' x2='260' y2='60' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='160' y='190' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>12</text><text x='190' y='150' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'><mi>h</mi></text><text x='250' y='90' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>9</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A rectangular prism with length 12, width 9, and height h. The space diagonal is labeled as 25.
questions.question: A rectangular prism has a length of <math><mn>12</mn></math>, a width of <math><mn>9</mn></math>, and height <math><mi>h</mi></math>. The length of a diagonal of the rectangular prism is <math><mn>25</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>h</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The space diagonal <math><mi>d</mi></math> of a rectangular prism with dimensions <math><mi>l</mi></math>, <math><mi>w</mi></math>, <math><mi>h</mi></math> is given by <math><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mi>l</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></math>. Here, <math><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>, <math><mi>l</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, <math><mi>w</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. So, <math><mn>25</mn><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mn>12</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>9</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>144</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>81</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>225</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></math>. Square both sides: <math><mn>625</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>225</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Then <math><msup><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>625</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>225</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn></math>. So <math><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>400</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The space diagonal d of a rectangular prism with length l, width w, and height h is d = √(l² + w² + h²). Set up the equation using the given diagonal and solve for the unknown dimension.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><text x='200' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Scatterplot of Car Age vs. Value</text><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='40' y='260' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>0</text><text x='40' y='210' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>5</text><text x='40' y='160' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>10</text><text x='40' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>15</text><text x='40' y='60' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>20</text><text x='200' y='270' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>Age (years)</text><text x='15' y='150' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial' transform='rotate(-90,15,150)'>Value ($1,000)</text><circle cx='80' cy='230' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='120' cy='200' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='160' cy='180' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='240' cy='120' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='280' cy='90' r='4' fill='blue'/><circle cx='320' cy='70' r='4' fill='blue'/><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='340' y2='80' stroke='red' stroke-width='1.5' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A scatterplot with 7 data points showing a strong negative linear relationship between car age (x-axis, 0 to 20 years) and value (y-axis, 0 to 20 in $1,000s). A dashed red line of best fit is drawn through the points.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the age, in years, and the estimated value, in thousands of dollars, for each of seven used cars. The line of best fit is also shown. Based on the line of best fit, which of the following is closest to the estimated decrease in value, in thousands of dollars, for each additional year of age?
questions.explanation: The slope of the line of best fit represents the estimated change in value (in thousands of dollars) for a one-year increase in age. The line appears to pass near points (0, ~18) and (20, ~2). The slope is calculated as (change in y) / (change in x) = (2 - 18) / (20 - 0) = (-16) / 20 = -0.8. The negative sign indicates a decrease. Therefore, the estimated decrease is 0.8 thousand dollars per year.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In a scatterplot with a line of best fit, the slope of the line represents the average rate of change of y with respect to x. Choose two points on the line (not necessarily data points) to calculate the slope accurately.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by a linear equation. If <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> and <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>f</mi></math> is linear, it can be written as <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. The slope <math><mi>m</mi></math> is <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Using point (3,10): <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math> → <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math> → <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>19</mn></math>. So <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>19</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>19</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>19</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a linear function f, use two given points to find the slope m = (y2 - y1)/(x2 - x1), then use one point to solve for the y-intercept b in f(x) = mx + b.

questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn></math> for all values of <math><mi>x</mi></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation:
Expand the left side: (x+5)(x−k)=x2−kx+5x−5k=x2+(5−k)x−5k. This must equal x2−4x−45 for all x. Therefore, equate coefficients:
For the x-term: 5−k=−4 → k=9.
For the constant term: −5k=−45 → k=9. Both conditions give k=9.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If two polynomials are equal for all values of x, then their corresponding coefficients must be equal. Expand and match coefficients to solve for unknowns.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: Working alone, Printer A can print 300 pages in 20 minutes. Working alone, Printer B can print 300 pages in 30 minutes. How many minutes would it take both printers, working simultaneously at their constant rates, to print 300 pages?
questions.explanation: First, find the individual rates: Printer A's rate is <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mtext> pages</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> min</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math> pages per minute. Printer B's rate is <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> pages per minute. Working together, their combined rate is <math><mn>15</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math> pages per minute. To print 300 pages, time = <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mtext> pages</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn><mtext> pages/min</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> minutes.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For combined work problems, find each individual rate (output per unit time), add the rates to get the combined rate, then divide the total work by the combined rate.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='350' height='300' viewBox='0 0 350 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='350' height='300' fill='white'/><text x='175' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='14' font-family='Arial'>Note: Figure not drawn to scale.</text><circle cx='175' cy='150' r='80' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='175' y1='150' x2='255' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='175' y1='150' x2='175' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='175' y1='150' x2='115' y2='210' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='180' y='145' text-anchor='start' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>O</text><text x='260' y='155' text-anchor='start' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>A</text><text x='175' y='65' text-anchor='start' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>B</text><text x='110' y='215' text-anchor='start' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'>C</text><text x='220' y='130' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'><mn>8</mn></text><text x='140' y='80' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-family='Arial'><mn>8</mn></text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Circle with center O. Points A, B, and C are on the circle such that OA, OB, and OC are radii of length 8. Angle AOB is a right angle (90 degrees). Points A, O, and C are collinear, with A and C on opposite sides of O.
questions.question: In the figure, circle O has a radius of <math><mn>8</mn></math>. Points A, B, and C lie on the circle such that <math><mi>O</mi><mi>A</mi><mo>⊥</mo><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></math> and A, O, and C are collinear. What is the length of minor arc <math><mover><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow><mo>⌒</mo></mover></math>?
questions.explanation: Since A, O, and C are collinear, A and C are endpoints of a diameter. The measure of arc AC is 180° (a semicircle). The circumference of the circle is <math><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><mi>π</mi></math>. The length of arc AC is half the circumference: <math><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>16</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The length of an arc is (central angle in degrees / 360) × (circumference). Identify the central angle that subtends the arc in question.

questions.question: A box contains only red marbles and blue marbles. The probability of randomly selecting a red marble is <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>. If 12 blue marbles are added to the box and no red marbles are added, the probability of randomly selecting a red marble becomes <math><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. How many red marbles are in the box?
questions.explanation: Let <math><mi>r</mi></math> be the number of red marbles and <math><mi>b</mi></math> be the original number of blue marbles. The original probability: <math><mfrac><mi>r</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>. Cross-multiply: <math><mn>8</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi></math> → <math><mn>5</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi></math> → <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>r</mi></math>. After adding 12 blue marbles, the new number of blue marbles is <math><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. The new probability: <math><mfrac><mi>r</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. Cross-multiply: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mn>3</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Substitute <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>r</mi></math>: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Multiply by 3: <math><mn>9</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>36</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math> → <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Set up equations based on the probability formula: probability = (favorable outcomes) / (total outcomes). Use variables for unknown counts and solve the system.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>g</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation:
g(0)=20+3=23=8.
g(1)=21+3=24=16.
Sum = 8+16=24.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For exponential functions, carefully evaluate the exponent. Substitute the given x-value into the expression and compute the power.
